<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Indicate by check mark whether the registrants (1)&nbsp;have filed all reports required to be filed
by Section&nbsp;13 or </I><I>15(d)</I><I> of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 during the preceding 12&nbsp;months (or
for such shorter period that the registrants were required to file such reports), and (2)&nbsp;have been
subject to such filing requirements for the past 90&nbsp;days.</I>&nbsp;<I>Yes</I>&nbsp;<FONT face="Wingdings">&#254;</FONT>&nbsp;<I>No</I>&nbsp;<FONT face="Wingdings">&#111;</FONT>
</DIV>

filer&#148; in Rule&nbsp;12b-2 of the Exchange Act. (Check one):</I>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This combined Form 10-Q is separately filed by The Southern Company, Alabama Power
Company, Georgia Power Company, Gulf Power Company, Mississippi Power Company, and Southern Power
Company. Information contained herein relating to any individual registrant is filed by such
registrant on its own behalf. Each registrant makes no representation as to information relating to
the other registrants.

    <TD colspan="3" valign="top" align="left"><A href="#342">Item 3.</A></TD>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>CAUTIONARY STATEMENT REGARDING FORWARD-LOOKING INFORMATION</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q contains forward-looking statements.
Forward-looking statements include, among other things, statements concerning the strategic goals
for the wholesale business, retail sales growth, customer growth, storm damage cost recovery and
repairs, fuel cost recovery, environmental regulations and expenditures, access to sources of
capital, projections for postretirement benefit trust contributions, synthetic fuel investments,
financing activities, completion or termination of construction projects, impacts of adoption of
new accounting rules, PPA revenues, costs of implementing the IIC settlement with the FERC, and
estimated construction and other expenditures. In some cases, forward-looking statements can be
identified by terminology such as &#147;may,&#148; &#147;will,&#148; &#147;could,&#148; &#147;should,&#148; &#147;expects,&#148; &#147;plans,&#148;
&#147;anticipates,&#148; &#147;believes,&#148; &#147;estimates,&#148; &#147;projects,&#148; &#147;predicts,&#148; &#147;potential,&#148; or &#147;continue&#148; or the
negative of these terms or other similar terminology. There are various factors that could cause
actual results to differ materially from those suggested by the forward-looking statements;
accordingly, there can be no assurance that such indicated results will be realized. These factors
include:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the impact of recent and future federal and state regulatory change, including legislative and regulatory
initiatives regarding deregulation and restructuring of the electric utility industry, implementation of the Energy
Policy Act of 2005, environmental laws including regulation of emissions of sulfur, nitrogen, mercury, carbon,
soot, or particulate matter and other substances, and also changes in tax and other laws and regulations to which
Southern Company and its subsidiaries are subject, as well as changes in application of existing laws and
regulations;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>current and future litigation, regulatory investigations, proceedings or inquiries, including the pending EPA civil
actions against certain Southern Company subsidiaries, FERC matters, IRS audits, and Mirant matters;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the effects, extent, and timing of the entry of additional competition in the markets in which Southern Company&#146;s
subsidiaries operate;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>variations in demand for electricity, including those relating to weather, the general economy and population, and
business growth (and declines);</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the performance of projects undertaken by the non-utility businesses and the success of efforts to invest in and
develop new opportunities;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>fluctuations in the level of oil prices;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the level of production by the synthetic fuel operations at Carbontronics Synfuels Investors LP and Alabama Fuel
Products, LLC for the remainder of fiscal year 2007;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>

</TR>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>

assured to be completed or beneficial to Southern Company or its subsidiaries;</TD>
</TR>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">

</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">The accompanying notes as they relate to Southern Company are an integral part of these condensed financial statements.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->10<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left">
<A name="310"></A>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>THE SOUTHERN COMPANY AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES</B><BR>
MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF<BR>
FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">SECOND QUARTER 2007 vs. SECOND QUARTER 2006<BR>
AND<BR>
YEAR-TO-DATE 2007 vs. YEAR-TO-DATE 2006

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>OVERVIEW</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Discussion of the results of operations is focused on Southern Company&#146;s primary business of
electricity sales in the Southeast by the traditional operating companies &#151; Alabama Power, Georgia
Power, Gulf Power, and Mississippi Power &#151; and Southern Power. Southern Power is an electric
wholesale generation subsidiary with market-based rate authority. Southern Company&#146;s other
business activities include investments in synthetic fuels and leveraged lease projects,
telecommunications, and energy-related services. For additional information on these businesses,
see BUSINESS &#151; The Southern Company System &#151; &#147;Traditional operating companies,&#148; &#147;Southern Power,&#148;
and &#147;Other Business&#148; in Item&nbsp;1 of the Form 10-K. For information regarding the synthetic fuel
investment, see Note (B)&nbsp;to the Condensed Financial Statements under &#147;INCOME TAX MATTERS &#151;
Synthetic Fuel Tax Credits&#148; herein.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Southern Company continues to focus on several key performance indicators. These indicators include
customer satisfaction, plant availability, system reliability, and earnings per share. For
additional information on these indicators, see MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS &#151; OVERVIEW &#151;
&#147;Key Performance Indicators&#148; of Southern Company in Item&nbsp;7 of the Form 10-K.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B><I>Net Income</I></B>

</DIV>
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="center" colspan="3">Second Quarter 2007 vs. Second Quarter 2006</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" colspan="3">Year-to-Date 2007 vs. Year-to-Date 2006</TD>
</TR>

<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="7" valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD align="center" valign="top"><I>(change in millions)</I>
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top"><I>(% change)</I>
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top"><I>(change in millions)</I>
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top"><I>(% change)</I></TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD align="center" valign="top">$44.0
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">11.4
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">$121.0
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">18.7</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="7" valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Southern Company&#146;s second quarter 2007 earnings were $429.2&nbsp;million ($0.57 per share) compared to
$385.2&nbsp;million ($0.52 per share) for second quarter 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Southern Company&#146;s year-to-date 2007 earnings were $767.8&nbsp;million ($1.02 per share) compared to
$646.8&nbsp;million ($0.87 per share) for year-to-date 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The increases for the second quarter and year-to-date 2007 when compared to the same periods in
2006 resulted primarily from higher revenues due to customer growth in the Southern Company service
area, favorable weather as compared to the same periods in 2006, higher tax credits from the
synthetic fuel business, and a retail base rate increase at Alabama Power. Sustained economic
strength in the Southern Company service area also contributed to the year-to-date 2007 increase in
earnings. The second quarter and year-to-date 2007 increases were partially offset by higher
maintenance expense, higher interest expense, higher depreciation and amortization, and a decrease
in contributions by market-based rates to large commercial and industrial customers when compared
to the same period in 2006.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B><I>Retail Revenues</I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="center" colspan="3">Second Quarter 2007 vs. Second Quarter 2006</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" colspan="3">Year-to-Date 2007 vs. Year-to-Date 2006</TD>
</TR>

<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="7" valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD align="center" valign="top"><I>(change in millions)</I>
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top"><I>(% change)</I>
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top"><I>(change in millions)</I>
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD align="center" valign="top">$134.7
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">4.5
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">$407.1
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">7.5</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="7" valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In the second quarter 2007, retail revenues were $3.1&nbsp;billion compared to $3.0&nbsp;billion for the same
period in 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Year-to-date 2007, retail revenues were $5.8&nbsp;billion compared to $5.4&nbsp;billion for the same period
in 2006.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->13<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Revenues associated with changes in rates and pricing increased for second quarter and year-to-date
2007 when compared to the same periods in 2006 primarily as a result of an increase in base rates
at Alabama Power, partially offset by a decrease in contributions by market-based rates to large
commercial and industrial customers.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Revenues attributable to changes in sales growth increased for second quarter and year-to-date 2007
when compared to the same periods in 2006 due to a 0.3% and 1.8% increase in retail KWH sales,
respectively, resulting from continued customer growth. The number of retail customers increased
by 1.6% as of June 2007 compared to June 2006. Sustained economic strength in the Southern
Company service area also contributed to the year-to-date 2007 increase.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Revenues resulting from changes in weather increased because of favorable weather for second quarter
and year-to-date 2007 compared to the same periods in 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Fuel and other cost recovery revenues increased $96.9&nbsp;million in the second quarter of 2007 and $295.4&nbsp;million for
year-to-date 2007 when compared to the same periods in 2006. Electric rates for the traditional
operating companies include provisions to adjust billings for fluctuations in fuel costs, including
the energy component of purchased power costs. Under these provisions, fuel revenues generally
equal fuel expenses, including the fuel component of purchased power costs, and do not affect net
income.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B><I>Wholesale Revenues</I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">10.7</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">$112.8</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">13.2</TD>

<TR style="font-size: 1px">

</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In the second quarter 2007, wholesale revenues were $486.9&nbsp;million compared to $439.9&nbsp;million in
the same period in 2006. The increase was primarily a result of a rise in fuel revenues due to a
7.5% increase in the average unit cost of fuel per net KWH generated.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For year-to-date 2007, wholesale revenues were $967.6&nbsp;million compared to $854.8&nbsp;million for the
same period in 2006. The increase was primarily a result of a rise in fuel revenues due to a 10.5%
increase in the average unit cost of fuel per net KWH generated.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Short-term opportunity sales also contributed to the increases over the same periods in 2006 due to
favorable weather compared to neighboring territories and a favorable price differential between
market prices and Southern Company&#146;s marginal cost. Short-term opportunity sales are made at
market-based rates that generally provide a margin above Southern Company&#146;s variable cost to
produce the energy.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->14<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
</DIV>

$13.5

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In the second quarter 2007, other electric revenues were $129.6&nbsp;million compared to $116.1&nbsp;million
in the same period in 2006. The increase was primarily a result of an increase in transmission
revenues of $5.6&nbsp;million, an increase in revenues of $3.2&nbsp;million resulting from increased sales of
electricity to co-generation customers due to higher natural gas prices, and an increase in
customer fees of $2.0&nbsp;million.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For year-to-date 2007, other electric revenues were $250.9&nbsp;million compared to $227.1&nbsp;million in
the same period in 2006. The increase was primarily a result of an increase in transmission
revenues of $12.4&nbsp;million, an increase in customer fees of $3.5&nbsp;million, and an increase in outdoor
lighting revenues of $3.4&nbsp;million.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Transmission revenues are generally offset by related expenses and do not significantly affect net
income.
</DIV>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD align="right">111.2</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right">$</TD>
    <TD align="right">338.8</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="5" align="left" style="border-top: 3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" align="left" style="border-top: 3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Fuel and purchased power expenses for the second quarter 2007 were $1.6&nbsp;billion compared to $1.4
billion for the corresponding period in 2006. The increase in fuel and purchased power expenses
was due to a $98.3&nbsp;million net increase in the average cost of fuel and purchased power as well as
a $12.9&nbsp;million net increase related to total KWH generated and purchased when compared to the same
period in 2006. The net increase in the average cost of fuel and purchased power for the second
quarter 2007 compared to the corresponding period in 2006 resulted from rising fossil
fuel prices and a 4.5% increase in fossil fuel generation by Southern Company-owned facilities
primarily due to a 58.0% decrease in hydro generation from lack of rainfall.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Fuel and purchased power expenses for year-to-date 2007 were $2.9&nbsp;billion compared to $2.6&nbsp;billion
for the corresponding period in 2006. The increase in fuel and purchased power expenses was due to
a $240.4&nbsp;million net increase in the average cost of fuel and purchased power as well as a $98.4
million net increase related to total KWH generated and purchased when compared to the same period
in 2006. The net increase in the average cost of fuel and purchased power for year-to-date
2007 compared to the corresponding period in 2006 resulted from rising fossil
fuel prices and an 8.0% increase in fossil fuel generation by Southern Company-owned
facilities primarily due to a 47.4% decrease in hydro generation from lack of rainfall.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Details of Southern Company&#146;s cost of generation and purchased power are as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="28%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>THE SOUTHERN COMPANY AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES</B><BR>
MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF<BR>
FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Increases in fuel expense at the traditional operating companies are generally offset by fuel
revenues and do not affect net income. See FUTURE EARNINGS POTENTIAL &#151; &#147;FERC and State PSC
Matters &#151; Retail Fuel Cost Recovery&#148; herein for additional information. Fuel expenses incurred
under Southern Power&#146;s PPAs are generally the responsibility of the counterparties and do not
significantly affect net income.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B><I>Maintenance Expense</I></B>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In the second quarter 2007, maintenance expense was $289.0&nbsp;million compared to $273.3&nbsp;million in
the same period in 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For year-to-date 2007, maintenance expense was $571.0&nbsp;million compared to $556.9&nbsp;million in the
same period in 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The second quarter and year-to-date 2007 increases were primarily a result of timing differences
related to maintenance performed on power generation facilities and increased costs associated with
these maintenance activities.
</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For year-to-date 2007, depreciation and amortization was $616.6&nbsp;million compared to $596.5&nbsp;million
in the same period in 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The second quarter and year-to-date 2007 increases were a result of the acquisitions of Plants
DeSoto and Rowan in June and September&nbsp;2006, respectively, as well as additional investment in
environmental projects, primarily at Alabama Power and Georgia Power.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B><I>Equity in Losses of Unconsolidated Subsidiaries</I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="center" colspan="3">Second Quarter 2007 vs. Second Quarter 2006</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" colspan="3">Year-to-Date 2007 vs. Year-to-Date 2006</TD>
</TR>

<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="7" valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD align="center" valign="top"><I>(change in millions)</I><BR>

</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top"><I>(% change)</I><BR>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top"><I>(% change)</I><BR>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 10pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD align="center" valign="top">
$1.3
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">
10.5
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">
$(24.6)
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">
(54.7)</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="7" valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The second quarter 2007 equity in losses of unconsolidated subsidiaries was $13.6&nbsp;million compared
to $12.3&nbsp;million for the same period in 2006. Southern Company made investments in two synthetic
fuel production facilities that generate operating losses. These investments also allow Southern
Company to claim federal income tax credits that offset these operating losses and make the
projects profitable. The increase in equity in losses of unconsolidated subsidiaries for the
second quarter 2007 when compared with the same period in 2006 was primarily the result of higher
operating expenses at one of the synthetic fuel entities due to idled production for a portion of
the second quarter 2006. The increase was partially offset by the termination of Southern
Company&#146;s membership interest in the other synthetic fuel entity in 2006 which eliminated the
funding obligation and Southern Company&#146;s share of losses for the second quarter 2007. See FUTURE
EARNINGS POTENTIAL &#151; &#147;Income Tax Matters &#151; Synthetic Fuel Tax Credits&#148; and Note (B)&nbsp;to the
Condensed Financial Statements under &#147;INCOME TAX MATTERS &#151; Synthetic Fuel Tax Credits&#148; herein for
further information.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For year-to-date 2007, equity in losses of unconsolidated subsidiaries was $20.3&nbsp;million compared
to $44.9&nbsp;million for the same period in 2006. The decrease in equity in losses of unconsolidated
subsidiaries for year-to-date 2007 when compared with the same period in 2006 was primarily the
result of terminating Southern Company&#146;s membership interest in one of the synthetic fuel entities
in 2006 which eliminated the funding obligation and Southern Company&#146;s share of losses for
year-to-date 2007, partially offset by higher operating expenses at the other synthetic fuel entity
due to idled production for a portion of second quarter 2006.
</DIV>

<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Leveraged lease income for the second quarter 2007 was $9.7&nbsp;million compared to $17.6&nbsp;million for
the corresponding period in 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Leveraged lease income for year-to-date 2007 was $19.6&nbsp;million compared to $35.7&nbsp;million for the
corresponding period in 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Southern Company has several leveraged lease agreements which relate to international and domestic
energy generation, distribution, and transportation assets. Southern Company receives federal
income tax deductions for depreciation and amortization, as well as interest on long-term debt
related to these investments. The adoption of FASB Staff Position No.&nbsp;FAS 13-2 (FSP 13-2),
&#147;Accounting for a Change or Projected Change in the Timing of Cash Flows Relating to Income Taxes
Generated by a Leveraged Lease Transaction&#148; resulted in decreases to leveraged lease pre-tax income
of $6.6&nbsp;million and $13.1&nbsp;million for the second quarter and year-to-date 2007, respectively, when
compared to the same periods in 2006. See FUTURE EARNINGS POTENTIAL &#151; &#147;Income Tax Matters &#151;
Leveraged Lease Transactions&#148; and Note (B)&nbsp;to the Condensed Financial Statements under &#147;INCOME TAX
MATTERS &#151; Leveraged Lease Transactions&#148; herein for further information.
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>THE SOUTHERN COMPANY AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES</B><BR>
MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF<BR>
FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Impairment loss on equity method investments for the second quarter and year-to-date 2007 was $0.0
million compared to $15.3&nbsp;million for the corresponding periods in 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The second quarter and year-to-date 2007 decreases were a result of impairment losses of $15.3
million recognized during the second quarter 2006 related to Southern Company&#146;s investments in two
synthetic fuel production facilities. See FUTURE EARNINGS POTENTIAL &#151; &#147;Income Tax Matters &#151;
Synthetic Fuel Tax Credits&#148; and Note (B)&nbsp;to the Condensed Financial Statements under &#147;INCOME TAX
MATTERS &#151; Synthetic Fuel Tax Credits&#148; herein for further information.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Interest expense, net of amounts capitalized for the second quarter 2007 was $200.2&nbsp;million
compared to $180.7&nbsp;million for the corresponding period in 2006. The increase was a result of a
$27.0&nbsp;million increase associated with $1.7&nbsp;billion in additional debt outstanding at June&nbsp;30, 2007
compared to June&nbsp;30, 2006 and higher interest rates associated with the issuance of new long-term
debt. Also contributing to the increase was $2.9&nbsp;million related to an increase in average
interest rates on variable rate debt. These increases were partially offset by $10.5&nbsp;million
associated with capitalized interest and allowance for debt funds used during construction. See
MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS &#151; FINANCIAL CONDITION AND LIQUIDITY &#151; &#147;Financing Activities&#148;
of Southern Company in Item&nbsp;7 of the Form 10-K and herein for additional information.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Interest expense, net of amounts capitalized for year-to-date 2007 was $394.3&nbsp;million compared to
$357.1&nbsp;million for the corresponding period in 2006. The increase was a result of a $44.6&nbsp;million
increase associated with $1.7&nbsp;billion in additional debt outstanding at June&nbsp;30, 2007 compared to
June&nbsp;30, 2006 and higher interest rates associated with the issuance of new long-term debt. Also
contributing to the increase was $10.3&nbsp;million related to an increase associated in average
interest rates on variable rate debt. These increases were partially offset by $17.8&nbsp;million
associated with capitalized interest and allowance for debt funds used during construction.
</DIV>

long-term debt payable to affiliated trusts in December&nbsp;2006.

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>THE SOUTHERN COMPANY AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES</B><BR>
MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF<BR>
FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In the second quarter 2007, other income (expense), net was $(6.0) million compared to $11.6
million for the same period in 2006 primarily as a result of a $10.0&nbsp;million increase in expense
due to changes in the value of derivative transactions in the second quarter 2007 and the release
of $6.3&nbsp;million in certain obligations associated with the termination of Southern Company&#146;s
membership interest in a synthetic fuel entity in 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For year-to-date 2007, other income (expense), net was $(8.9) million compared to $3.2&nbsp;million for
the same period in 2006 primarily as a result of the release of $6.3&nbsp;million in certain obligations
associated with the termination of Southern Company&#146;s membership interest in a synthetic fuel
entity in 2006, $6.2&nbsp;million related to changes in the value of derivative transactions, and a $4.9
million decrease in miscellaneous income deductions. Partially offsetting the year-to-date 2007
decrease was Alabama Power&#146;s recognition of $5.0&nbsp;million associated with the consent decree entered
in the NSR litigation in 2006. See Note 3 to the financial statements of Southern Company under
&#147;Environmental Matters &#151; New Source Review Actions&#148; in Item&nbsp;8 of the Form 10-K and Note (B)&nbsp;to the
Condensed Financial Statements under &#147;NEW SOURCE REVIEW LITIGATION&#148; herein for further information.
</DIV>
